security: This document contains code word material no foreign dissemination. This document MUST NOT BE RELEASED TO FOREIGN GOVERNMENTS.
summary: This is the Central Intelligence Agency's Weekly Review from December 27, 1963, providing updates on global events, including Soviet trade activity, Chinese Communist leaders' African tour, East German reactions to relaxed Berlin travel, North Korea's improved air defense, flagging enthusiasm for the South Vietnam regime, situations in Laos and Cambodia, Arab plans regarding Israeli projects, and the Cyprus dispute.
summary_one_paragraph: The CIA's Weekly Review, dated December 27, 1963, summarizes key international developments: Soviet traders resumed contacts in the industrial West following Khrushchev's chemical industry plan approval; Chou En-lai and Chen Yi projected Afro-Asian amity during their African tour; East Germans expressed cautious hope for further relaxation of Berlin travel restrictions; North Korea improved its air defense capabilities; enthusiasm waned for the South Vietnam regime; Communist forces in Laos moved to erase rightist gains; a French minister planned a visit to Cambodia to strengthen French influence; Arab states planned no overt action against an Israeli project; and the Cyprus dispute flared again. It also notes domestic politics in Cuba, challenges in the Dominican regime, Brazil's financial problems, and tensions between Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince and King.
title: Weekly Review
